numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In general, I notice a line in the graph.
2. A point that is closer to the line indicates that the old and the young are closer in satisfaction in a country.
3. In Indonesia, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
4. In India, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
5. In Nigeria, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
6. In Bangladesh, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
7. In Morocco, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
8. In Mali, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
9. In Japan, there is a huge difference in satisfaction between the young and the old.
10. In the US, there is a huge difference in satisfaction between the young and the old.
11. I wonder why most dots that are close to the line are from Africa.
12. I wonder why young people are more satisfied with their country.
13. I think that a more developed country has a higher level of satisfaction of the masses.
14. I ask what is going on in this graph.
15. I ask whether the world has gotten better.
16. I ask whether the world has gotten worse.
